etymology.description: 大(大) (dà, "big; great") + 丶(added dot) = differentiated to represent 太(tài, "too big")
etymology.interpretation: 太(tài, "too") evolved as a variation of 大(大) (dà, "big") with an additional dot to convey the sense of excessiveness or extremity. This reflects the character's meaning of being "too" or "very".

examples.chinese: 今天太热了(今天太熱了)。
这个房间太宽敞了(這個房間太寬敞了)。
他的工作太辛苦了(他的工作太辛苦了)，需要更多的休息(需要更多的休息)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de gōngzuò tài xīnkǔ le, xūyào gèng duō de xiūxí.
examples.english: His work is too strenuous; he needs more rest.
